item.title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle PS5 release date confirmed
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/indiana-jones-and-the-great-circle-ps5-release-date-confirmed

In skit featuring crossover with Uncharted's Nolan North.

Prepare your best shocked face - Indiana Jones and the Great Circle will launch for PlayStation 5 on 17th April.

The announcement today might have leaked, but here's something you perhaps were not expecting - a skit featuring video game Indiana Jones Troy Baker, and Uncharted lead actor Nolan North.

Together, the two do their best to wring out 90 seconds of content from, well, the date written above. If you're a fan of Uncharted, or Trey, sorry, Troy Baker, this will likely raise a smile or two:

Alongside the game, a Collector's Bundle will be available with a physical game case (though you'll still need to download the game), an adventure journal book, a stone tablet replica, a globe (with hidden storage) and up to two days early access to the upcoming The Order of the Giants story DLC. Also included is a Temple of Doom outfit, and The Last Crusade travelling suit and lion tamer whip.

Quite simply, PS5 owners are in for a treat - Indiana Jones was one of the best games of 2024, a brilliant and authentic-feeling adventure from Wolfenstein developer MachineGames, and probably the best Indiana Jones video game ever made.

"Smart, fun and so very Indiana Jones, The Great Circle is a stealth action tour de force that marks a bold new era for MachineGames," Katharine wrote in Eurogamer's Indiana Jones and the Great Circle review.
